reasoning: Tinea Corporis is one of the most common dermatophyte infections, estimated at ~200-300 per 100k person-years globally. Reporting incidence (new diagnosed cases). Geographic variation significant: higher in tropical/subtropical regions (>400 per 100k) vs temperate regions (<150 per 100k).
source: Hay RJ et al. (2012). Global skin disease burden. Lancet. 380(9852):1604-1609
